subsc: General transportation sector,Sub-national government administration,Roads and highways,Flood protection
trustfund: TF021385-SINDH URBAN DEVELOPMENT II,TF021365-IRRIGATION SECTOR PROJECT,TF020097-SINDH COMMUNITY SHELTER PROGRAM,TF022587-PHRD-KARACHI URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF022510-PRIVATE POWER DEVELOPMENT,TF027680-SIND URBAN DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
Two major external factors significantly
            contributed to the unsatisfactory project outcome: law and
            order problems in Sindh, especially in Karachi; and
            political stability in Sindh. The law and order problems in
            Karachi throughout the project period troubled all the
            parties involved (implementing agencies, contractors and
            consultants, and IDA's supervision missions), delaying
            many project activities and making site visits impossible.
            The political instability in Sindh, resulting in four
            government changes during the project period, was also the
            key factor for the deficient implementation, especially of
            the policy reform components. Three main factors which the
            government could have controlled-its commitment, appointment
            delays and frequent staff changes in key agencies; and
            timely release and availability of counterpart
            funds--adversely affected project implementation. The
            implementing agency adversely affected project
            implementation with poor work planning, poor contract
            management, poor pre-qualification of contractors and
            shortlisting of consultants, delays in seeking required
            clearances, and poor project financial management. Hence
            project sustainability is unlikely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are rated unsatisfactory. The Bank
            failed to secure the government's commitment, assess
            the serious risk of political change, target civil society
            to establish consensus, restructure the project in time,
            shorten project length, and strengthen financial management.
